document.heading: Access to Psychologists and Optometrists Act

history.narrative: Law 1-46, the “Access to Psychologists and Optometrists Act,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 1-86, which was referred to the Committee on Human Resources and Aging. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 7, 1975, and October 21, 1975, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on November 7, 1975, it was assigned Act No. 1-64 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
